name: Send Training Notifications Using SecurityCoach Delivery Methods
title: Send Training Notifications Using SecurityCoach Delivery Methods
body:
If you have access to SecurityCoach, you can send Training Notifications to your users via Slack, Microsoft Teams, or Google Chat. You can set up SecurityCoach integrations with Slack, Microsoft Teams, and Google Chat to be used as delivery methods for SecurityTips. Since SecurityCoach is a product within the KSAT console, you can use these same integrations to send your users notifications about their assigned training.

Important:You must first set up your delivery methods in SecurityCoach to send training notifications via Slack and Microsoft Teams. To learn how to set up these delivery methods see our Slack Integration Guide, Microsoft Teams Integration Guide, or Google Chat Integration Guide.

Once your SecurityCoach delivery methods have been set up, you can select the delivery method wherever you set up a training notification. You can set up training notifications when you create a new training campaign or edit an existing training campaign. You also have the option to send manual notifications from the campaign Overview or Users subtabs. The gif below shows the three areas of the console where you can set up training notifications.

To send a training notification using your SecurityCoach delivery method, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to one of the areas in the console where you can set up training notifications.
  2. Click on the applicable button to add new a training notification.
  3. From the top of the training notification section, select your preferred delivery method.
  4. We recommend selecting the Fallback to email delivery option. When this option is enabled, notifications will be used as a backup delivery method if your primary delivery method is unavailable.
  5. Select your notification type.
  6. Select the recipient types and specific notification templates.
    Important:Not all training notification templates are optimized for Slack and Microsoft Teams. We recommend setting up a training campaign assigned to select admins to test your selected notification templates before sending them out to your users.
  7. Click Save.

For more information about training notifications in general see our Training Campaign Notifications article.

This description details a configuration panel focused on content selection, tracking options, and user group enrollment settings.

**1. Content Selection and Configuration:**
*   **Content Field:** A multi-select dropdown field with the placeholder text: "Select one or more items from the list..."
*   **Action Link:** "Visit ModStore" (located top right).
*   **Action Button:** A blue button featuring a circular refresh/update icon is adjacent to the Content field.
*   **Options (Checkboxes):**
    *   `[ ]` Enable Content Survey (?)
    *   `[ ]` Track Scores (?)

**2. Group Enrollment Settings:**
*   **Label:** "Enroll Groups."
*   **Enrollment Type (Segmented Control):** A toggle set to **Specific Groups** (highlighted in dark gray). **All Users** is deselected (light gray/white).
*   **Action Link:** "View All Groups" (located above the group selection field).
*   **Group Field:** A multi-select dropdown field with the placeholder text: "Select one or more groups from the list..."
*   **Action Button:** A blue button featuring a circular refresh/update icon is adjacent to the Group field.

**3. Automatic Enrollment and Remediation:**
*   **Option 1 (Enabled):**
    *   `[X]` Enable automatic enrollment for new users (?)
*   **Option 2 (Disabled/Grayed Out):**
    *   `[ ]` Enable progress reset for remedial training (?)

*(Note: The `(?)` symbol indicates an interactive tooltip or help link for the corresponding setting.)*

images.alt:
This screenshot displays a user interface form section dedicated to configuring notification delivery settings and template assignment for various user roles.

**I. Delivery Configuration (Highlighted Section)**

*   **Delivery Method:** A segmented button control allows selection between two methods.
    *   **Email** (Unselected)
    *   **Microsoft Teams** (Selected, dark grey background)
*   **Fallback Option:** A checkbox labeled "Fallback to email delivery" is present and currently unchecked.

**II. Contextual Warning Banner**

*   A light orange informational banner warns the user: "Please test your selected templates, as some templates aren't designed for Slack or Microsoft Teams."

**III. Notification and Recipient Setup**

*   **Notification Type:** A single input field with the placeholder text "Select Notification Type" is available via a dropdown menu.
*   **Recipient and Template Assignment:** This section is structured as a three-row grid for assigning templates to different roles. Each row includes:
    1.  A checkbox (all currently unchecked).
    2.  A recipient role label followed by a help/contextual information icon: **User**, **Manager**, **Admin**.
    3.  A dropdown input field with the placeholder "Select Template".
    4.  A blue "Preview" icon (stylized eye) to the far right of the template field.
*   **Template Management Link:** A hyperlink below the grid provides quick access to "Manage Training Notification Templates".

**IV. Form Actions**

*   Two action buttons are positioned at the bottom left:
    *   **Save** (Primary button, blue background)
    *   **Cancel** (Secondary button, grey background)
